name: Hotel 1898

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the beginning of August for three nights. I emailed the hotel a couple of days before our arrival to check that the booking was confirmed and mentioned that we were celebrating our wedding anniversay. We were over the moon when we arrived and had been upgraded from a standard to a superior room! It was gorgeous - the decor is really sleek and modern and the room was quite spacious.
reviews.title: Fabulous hotel
Great Hotel
reviews.text: The rooftop terrace and pool is a fantastic bonus - just what you need after a morning's sightseeing. A great way to chill out and relax in the sun for an hour! The spa in the basement is small but immaculate - loved the jacuzzi water bed!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff at the hotel were all friendly and helpful, especially those on the roof terrace. Amazingly ,bar prices seemed quite reasonable when compared to every other bar and restaurant we visited! Barcelona is definitely not a cheap place to visit!
reviews.title: Loved Hotel 1898, Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I cannot recommend this hotel enough - we will definitely be going back.
reviews.title: Outstanding

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel 1898 is a very beautiful hotel in the heart of the market section of Las Ramblas. Everything you could possibly need is within two blocks of the hotel. The rooms are all high tech, spotless, and beautifully designed. They are small by American standards, but not an inch of space is wasted. We stayed in two superior, double rooms. The beds were big and comfortable and you have your choice of pillows. The bathrooms are large and gorgeous - all marble and chrome, with towel warmers and showers with full bathtubs. Everything is state-of-the art, which meant that sometimes we had to call the front desk to figure out how to get things to work. The common areas are open, beautiful and inviting. Staff is professional and friendly and you can always find someone who speaks English. There is a small swimming pool on top of the hotel, with a bar and a deck from which you can view all of Barcelona. The hotel is on a part of Las Ramblas that is packed with tourists, but it is fun to walk down the street and see all of the street artists and visit the vendors. The surrounding streets are lined with stores, good restaurants and cafes. We only spent one night in Barcelona en route to somewhere else, but Hotel 1898 was one of the highlights of our trips.
reviews.title: Really enjoyed Hotel 1898

likes.disliked: — Excessive prices of drinks at rooftop bar

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked in to this hotel and stayed in their junior suite. We were blown away by it. It is worth every penny. The staff are friendly and very efficient. We had a knock on the door after we got into the room and were greeted by a comp bottle of bubbly and an enormous fruit basket!
reviews.title: Best hotel ever

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast is pricy but you get to choose from a huge selection of food and eat as much as you want so you can get your moneys worth.
reviews.title: H1898 is just amazing!

likes.disliked: — No iron availbale for immediate use.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The roof top terrace is very special with a coktail bar and lots of comfortable double bed like sofas to lounge on and watch the sun go down.
reviews.title: Loved It. Refreshingly Different.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: The location is brilliant, you are in the heart of everything with shops and restaurants on the doorstep.
reviews.title: stylish and central

likes.disliked: — small closet space, but not really a problem

reviews.title: Great Hotel and Location
reviews.text: The hotel room was very quiet despite being central. We will definately head straight back to this hotel when we return to Barcelona!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The 1898 is a good, modern, efficient hotel located at the top of La Rambla.
reviews.title: A good hotel located at the centre of the action
An Easter treat!
reviews.text: It seems to have been recently refurbished, and to a high standard. The rooms are dark wood in decor and have an excellent lighting and air-con system.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The spa downstairs is adequate. The pool is small but comfortable, ditto the gym.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: One let-down is the bar area, which is long and narrow and a bit soulless, but as you've got literally hundreds of fantastic bars on your doorstep in Barca it's not a problem.
reviews.title: had a GREAT experience at this hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Even though it's located in the heart of La Rambla, the interior rooms are extremely quiet, so sleeping is not a problem. I took my 75-year old mum to the hotel and she slept no problem at all.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: We booked the hotel based on Trip Advisor rating and experience from sister Hotel Jazz (which is more modest and less expensive).
reviews.title: Location x 3, design and atmosphere

likes.liked: — Location, good design in rooms and public areas, fantastic suite with private pool!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: The experience lived up to our expectations. As we were a large family group, and we got one suite upgraded to a roof-top suite with a private pool, it actually surpassed our expectations!
reviews.title: Great Hotel - Fantastic for a small business meeting

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One thing to remember if you have the pool though, there are other rooms above your terrace, so it´s not for skinny dipping...
reviews.title: Very Enjoyable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The kids also tried the roof-top and inhouse pools, among which the indoor pool was the favourite.
reviews.title: excellent hotel loved every minute 5 star!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: To have a roof-top terrace with lots of nice sofas, chairs and tables - and a pool, right above the Ramblas, well it´s hard to beat!
reviews.title: Fantastic !!!

likes.liked: — Quality of the room, perfect location and price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed 3 nights and picked this based on Tripadvisor reviews. We were not disappointed as, whilst it isn't the cheapest hotel, the facilities and the staff are extremely good.
reviews.title: One of the best ever

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooftop pool and comfy seats were a really oasis after a busy day and the views were fantastic. The rooms, and in particular the bathrooms, were of the highest standard but the best of all was down in the basement. The pool may have been small but it was never too busy and, on top of excellent sauna and steam room, the pool had 2 water jets, the jacuzzi jets and jets in metal loungers in the pool to massage yourself with.
reviews.title: just better than expected

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: You cannot fault the quality of the hotel decor and the location is in the middle of Las Ramblas and so easy to go in either direction. Drinks were a bit expensive and whilst breakfast at 19 euros may be expensive for some, there was a Continental option at 9 euros.
reviews.title: Wonderful stay!

likes.liked: — The rooms were very nice and spacey

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: One of the best and easiest hotels we've ever stayed in.
reviews.title: eleven out of ten

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: ultra modern, very clean, great location, front desk very helpful.
reviews.title: Hotel 1898

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: This is a great hotel and we were most impressed with the location and rooms. If you are booked into a courtyard room take note that the courtyard is merely a large air shaft with some potted plants and it tends to be a little dark. We were advised to book that type of room as we were told the outside rooms tended to be affected by the street noise. The only negative one could say is that the staff tends to be a little stiff, unfriendly. We had asked for a wake up call to get to the airport and despite confirming the time it was made an hour late. We had also booked a van to get 4 people and bags to the airp[ort and again confirmed with the front desk t that it was ordered and would be there. The van did not arrive and the staff didn't appear to care. The only response was "that it was raining"....
reviews.title: Fantatic Place..indifferent staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just had a few days in Barcelona, we were looking for a Central hotel, decided to book Hotel 1898 based on tripadvisor reviews and could not be happier that we did. Location is great and central, but the room was still perfectly quiet. Booked the basic room, immaculate, modern and clean. Staff were helpful and friendly, breakfast buffet was great, and best still is the rooftop pool and bar. After a few hours touring and shopping to have a pool with great views to relax before going out in the evening was perfect. I have stayed in many hotels all over the world and would totally recommend this hotel we loved it.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Truly great stay at Hotel 1898 - if you are headed to Barcelona there should be no other choice. Great location - easy access to all major tourist spots - neighborhoods and subways. Clean and chic interiors - great amenities - roof top pool and bar is incredibly cool with great views and stylish setting - indoor spa is unique and very chic with great mix of services - solid business center - rooms are not huge - but very well thought out decorated and clean. Two pane windows so even though we had a partial view of las rambla where on the 3rd floor and the hotel next door was under construction - noise never bothered us at all.
reviews.title: The best in Barcelona

likes.liked: — Location and decorating of the hotel - its clean cool and chic.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is in the mix of Las Rambla - but it feels quiet and secluded while still being right in the mix of the city. And if you don't like crowds you should not go to Barcelona any way. Easy walking distance to the Boqeuria market - the contemporary art museum - the Gothic quarter and Picasso museum - Placa Catalan and all the other major neighborhoods - plus 2 minute walk to two major subway stations that can take you anywhere you else you might want to go.
reviews.title: Beautiful, stylish hotel

likes.liked: — Gorgeous room, friendly staff, good food
likes.disliked: — Price - top hotel but top dollar too!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I travel all the time stay at 5 star (Four Seasons etc) - this is just as good as any 5 start hotel.
reviews.title: Perfect location, top notch facilities

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in H1898 last weekend - beautiful decor and fab location but at €700 + VAT for three nights in March in a "compact room" I'm not sure I'd go back for a few reasons.
reviews.title: Nice but worth it ???

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: With such a fantastic city as Barcelona to see we spent very little time in the hotel but when we did it was REALLY REALLY noisey. The rooms have wooden floors so you hear people walking about in the rooms above and beside you, the areas besides the elevators were marble with the same result and the "bing" everytime the elevators stopped at our floor was also a bit loud.
reviews.title: Service hiccups and very noisy!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I'd reserved the room directly with the hotel in early January and requested an early check-in but when we arrived we were told that it wasn't possible because it was a busy weekend - it was 11.45am Friday
reviews.title: WOW! Fantastic hotel, should be 5 star.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: morning. We had to come back at 3 to check-in. Disappointing given the request was made months before directly with the hotel and the less than apologetic attitude of the receptionist.
reviews.title: Fantastic - a great hotel in a brilliant location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: That said the guys behind the bar in the hotel were great fun and make a mean cocktail (even if its pricey by Barcelona standards) and the pillows were amazing...but next time we'll stay in an apartment which seems to be the preferred option of quite a few people
reviews.title: Nice hotel but..

likes.disliked: — Noisy cleaning staff in the mornings

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All we can say is if you're thinking of staying here, book this hotel. We spent one night here after a 10-day cruise in Oct. 2006 and it was just what we needed to unwind. The rooms are bigger than you'd expect in Europe, with nicely appointed bathrooms and comfortable beds, which my husband discovered are adjustable. The spa in the basement is unreal and includes an indoor pool. The spa treatments are resonably priced. There is a rooftop pool with a bar and amazing views. The lobby is spacious and comfortable, sit down and you won't want to leave. Hotel 1898 is right on Las Ramblas, but it's not a noisy hotel. It's just a few blocks from La Boqueria, a must see if you're visiting Barcelona.
reviews.title: Stay at this hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Luca, the bartender, recommended an amazing restaturant, Made in Italy. The food was the best we had our whole vacation.
reviews.title: Luxury at a discount

likes.disliked: — don't eat in the restaurants on Ramblas, use side streets for better value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Thanks to other reviews about where to stay we chose 1898, this proved to be a success as I had wanted something special for my husband and I as this trip was to celebrate our anniversary. From the moment we entered the hotel the staff were friendly and helpful. What a suprise when we were shown our room, it was beautiful. Everything had been catered for and the cleanliness was amazing. We stayed in the basic room, which was all I could afford and I had a slight apprehension this may be equivalent to a broom cupboard. This was definately not the case and for the two of us it was more than adequate, especially as the break was not being spent in the room but in the beautiful city. The swimming pool and health spa were clean and well equipped. Overall I would stongly reccommend this hotel as a base for a stay in Barcelona as it is ideally situated on Ramblas for access to all the attractions.
reviews.title: A Decent Stay

likes.disliked: — A bit small, only a so-so value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled on business
reviews.text: My partner and I stayed here recently for 2 nights and enjoyed the hotel (booked it primarily because of the great reviews on tripadvisor). As for our experience, the hotel seemed quite new, which usually means a clean and modern decor, which we found to be true. Although our room itself was a bit small for a "superior" room, it was sufficient for our purposes. The room was equipped with free wifi access, an LCD tv (but with only one english channel, no movies or DVD), a minibar, safe & stand-up shower/ bath. Didn't use room service so I can't comment on that. The decor was quite cool and on the funky side, definitely comfortable. The spa facility was only basic and as such, I wouldn't recommend it (poor changing & lounge area, small but "neat" looking pool with unisex sauna / steam and a couple of treadmills to account for a gym). We had a massage which was okay but not remarkable. Overall, the price is reasonable for what's offered and we would consider staying here again. I'd suggest this hotel is a solid 3 1/2 star (would be a 4 if they took some of the details up a notch).
reviews.title: Stunning

likes.disliked: — Leave your valuables in the hotel,,,las ramblas will steal them ...be warned

reviews.title: Lives up to the good reviews
reviews.text: Outstanding Hotel, decor superb, rooms of the highest standard. Could not fault this hotel in any way. Roof top views stunning. Highly recommend staying here. You will not be the slightest dissapointed

reviews.title: Loved, Loved Loved it!
reviews.text: We stayed there for our 25th wedding anniversary and had a great time in Barcelona and at the hotel in general.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There was a problem with the hot water and it took me three attempts to persuade reception / maintenance to do anything about it.
reviews.title: Great location, rooms very disappointing and noisy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bar is great and the staff very friendly, there was always someone cleaning something so everywhere was spotless.
reviews.title: Fantasic. No Complaints

likes.disliked: — No ironing facilities only dry cleaning

reviews.title: Superb Hotel - worth the £151 without a doubt
reviews.text: The stay was not excellent in my opinion as we had a room with a marble floor outside and you could hear everyone walk past and the maid service trolly sounded like a tram coming down the corridor. I have to say the room cleaners were very noisy and did not seem to respect the fact that people wanted a lay in in the mornings!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: This is a fantastic hotel in great location. Please disregard any negative critiques as they are probably from stuffy clientele. The hotel is a 4 star property that I would consider 4.5! Thank you very much for our fanatastic 3 day recent stay
reviews.title: Recent stay- Wonderful!

likes.liked: — location, cleanliness, great bathrooms, pool on roof

reviews.title: Underwhelmed by 1898
reviews.text: Jim H in Atlanta, GA

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at 1898 July 3 - 5, 2007. My overall assessment is that it was not worth the price. The room was very tiny and without a patio it was close to claustrophobic. We tried to change rooms, but no luck from the front desk. Only one suitcase could be opened at a time.
reviews.title: Fabulous Hotel Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: However, the location is convenient We went to the opera, just a few minutes walk away. We saw Manon. Even if you're not an opera fan, Barcelona is the place to see one. The Opera House is exquisite. Make sure you buy your tickets on-line in advance. We had them sent from the opera to the hotel and they were waiting there for us on arrival.
reviews.title: Central, fantasic hotel.

likes.disliked: — The small pools and expensive bar.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Wow! We have stayed in many hotels over the years but this must rate as one of our favourites. Situated on La Rambla this is a perfect spot for visiting the sights of Barcelona. The hotel has a wonderful atmosphere, sophisticated but not stuffy. The day we arrived (after a traumatic train journey from France) we relaxed with lunch on the roof terrace followed by an hour in the downstairs pool ,steam and sauna and finished with a large cocktail and the last of the sun bt the rooftop pool! Sheer bliss!!!
reviews.title: Awesome Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked this hotel after reading reviews on this site and had high expectations!
reviews.title: Great sanctuary in choas of La Rambla

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: We arrived a little earlier than the 3pm check in but had emailed them in advance to let them know. The receptionist was astounding and told us that no-one had ever arrived early in Spain!! Hence our room wasn't ready and he could give us no time of when it would be! We did however get our swimsuits out of our case and enjoy the sun and the rooftop pool and bar!
reviews.title: Like the ARTs without the view of the sea and stupid high price !

likes.liked: — The quality and feel of the hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: We spent four nights here with our two children in late March. The location is excellent and the hotel wonderful. The indoor swimming pool and the rooftop terrace, also with pool, are delightful. We booked the hotel based in part on the glowing TripAdvisor reviews and were not disappointed. It is not cheap but is well worth the cost.
reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007
reviews.text: Chicago, USA
reviews.title: Understated but wonderful!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: if you blinked you would miss this hotel. no big sign, even our taxi driver hadn't heard of it. booked this hotel after reading the reviews on trip advisor for my sisters 21st birthday surprise. was worried i would be dissapointed with the hotel considering the price. I should not have worried and my sister loved it. yes you probably pay a bit extra for being right on the "Las Ramblas" but its worth it, its a great central location. the rooms are lovely, we stayed in one of their "classsic" rooms which are the cheapest and it was lovely and clean, nicely decorated, big comfy bed, gorgeous bathroom with fantastic shower. I stayed in another 4-star hotel in barcelona, which was more expensive, not on the las ramblas and not as nice. I would deffinately reccommend this hotel and probably more to couples and groups of adults than families.
reviews.title: BRAVO - fantastic hotel

likes.liked: — The service, the rooms and the spa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just returned from 3 days in Barca staying on Hotel 1898. It was a fantastic stay. The service, location, the cleaning, design and the rooms was so perfect and not to forget the most fantastic spa and roof terasse - also with pool and a great view of Barcelona.
reviews.title: Good Hotel, but Not Exceptional Value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007
reviews.text: While pleased with the 1898, I was dissappointed given the reviews I perused before booking there.
reviews.title: Wonderful Location; Not Quite as Good as Prior Reviews

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room we had - a superior room - was beautiful and looked over La Ramblas. Our luggage was delayed a day and the front desk staff was disinterested at best; restaurant recommendations were mechanical: they had a few restaurant cards in a drawer at the front desk and fished one out when an inquiry was made. Staff seemed to have little interest in getting folks to the right place for their budget-tastes.
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel with a great spa

likes.disliked: — view, staff could have been more friendly at check in

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Perhaps it was a language issuebut it did not spoil an otherwise wonderful stay, location is perfect and booking on the hotel website gave us the best rate which included a fabulous breakfast (otherwise 19 euros per person). I´d recommned but you need to do your own homework re: restaurants; tours etc.
reviews.title: Believe the reviews, the 1898 is really very good.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: A lovely hotel which couldn't be more central but was still lovely and quiet. The spa and roof top pool really make this hotel and are just what you need after a long days sightseeing.
reviews.title: Great rooftop pool

likes.disliked: — Scratched head, but really can't think of anything!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was comfy, spacious enough and the bathroom had a great huge rainwater shower head and bathrobe, slippers, nice toiletries etc. The only downside of the room was a rather dingy view over the back streets rather than the rambla that we were hoping for but it was nice and quiet probably because of this.
reviews.title: Fantastic place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: I was booked and had to stay at Le Meridien, across the street, for one night, but I kept looking at the Hotel 1898 because it is just so elegant, especially compared to Le Meridien. Needless to say, I quickly moved and was thrilled. This is a 5 star for Barcelona since hotels there are just so so, in general, but this one is on par with some of the best hotels I have stayed at. The place is brand, spanking new. It is immaculately clean (there are cleaning people everywhere), and it defines form and function (as opposed to many Spanish newer hotels which focus on form rather than function). I was so very impressed with every aspect of this hotel (and I can't say enough about how picky I am) that I wanted to post my thoughts asap. If you are going to Barcelona, this should be your first place to check for rates if you want a place in the center of town, beautiful big, clean rooms (I am not sure what happened with the previous reviewer but all the rooms I saw--211 was the size of a small apartment--were great), and an incredibly warm and welcoming staff. If you don't value these aspects, well, try Le Meridien...
reviews.title: Huge WOW!!!

likes.disliked: — I wish I had known about it before I checked myself into Le Meridien.

reviews.title: Excellent Hotel
reviews.text: Beauitful hotel in a central location leaving you not more than a few minutes from eveywhere you would want to be.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Beautiful entrance to the hotel and rooms brillant as weel. Although we opted for a standard room it was spacious and well presented. Excellent pool on the roof terrace! A must! And basement pool with sauna, etc!
reviews.title: Couldn't do better

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Would definitely stay again!
reviews.title: Some postives...some negatives...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked this at the last minute - at a bargain price too.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel, consistent high standards

likes.disliked: — Pool bar prices were a little steep!

reviews.title: Great Hotel, all the amenities!
reviews.text: I didn't have high expectations after previous Barcelona hotel experiences BUT - WOW!!!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just back from 2 nights (30/12/06 - 2/1/07) at the H1898. We booked it largely because of Tripadvisor reviews and, in all, it more than lived up to expectations. The decor throughout the hotel is something else and the service attentive and unobtrusive. Our room was beautiully decorated, comfortable, spacious and quiet. The only disappointment was the relatively early closure of the bar on New Year's Eve and on New Year's Day evening. It seemed that there was only 1 poor guy serving, with the bar closing at 1am or so. Not what one would have expected and a missed opportunity for the hotel to make a lot of cash from the willing residents. However this was a only a small disappointment in anotherwise super hotel.
reviews.title: New Year at H1898

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed two nights at the Le Meridien before walking across the street (appr. 3 meters) and having a look at the H1898. Totally different level of property. Makes the Meridien look like a 3-star hotel.
reviews.title: Truly great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We quickly switched to H1898 and stayed for a night. Everything from the breakfast, the room, the service, etc. is great. The only flaw to mention is that the subway must be passing by just under the hotel, making some noise every now and then. Not enough to wake you up though.
reviews.title: Never thought Barcelona could be this relaxing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Don't miss the heated pool and the terrace. Great view.
reviews.title: Would definitely stay again!
A brilliant hotel
reviews.text: We spent seven nights at the 1898 in the run up to Christmas, staying in a Superior Room at the back of the hotel, and found it excellent in every respect.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: I just came back from a business meeting held an the Hotel 1898. Overall, a great experience. Hotel rooms are okay size with beautiful wood floors and marble bathrooms. Also, the Etro products were nice. And the rain forest shower a great way to wake up. I stayed at a room on the 6th floor with a private patio. What a great experience! I would recommend this hotel for all travelers. It has a quite and tranquil athmosphere and you are just in front of one of the busiest areas: La Rambla and Barrio Gotic. I would go back anytime!
reviews.title: Histroy meets La Rambla

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel 1898 is right on Las Ramblas, centrally located near two metro stops. When we arrived at our room, we were very happy with its size, cleanliness and layout. We had a peek-a-boo view of Las Ramblas, which worried me a little - it can get loud at night, and we happened to be there at a time when drunken British soccer hooligans were out all night long singing their little soccer songs on Las Ramblas. But the windows are double-paned, and the lager louts did not disturb my sleep. There is a very cool indoor pool, sauna and exercise area in the basement of the hotel. The staff of the hotel were friendly, helpful and knowledgable. I would stay here again in a heartbeat.
reviews.title: Great location and great stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006
reviews.text: We chose the hotel after all the great reviews we read about it but it really did not live to its reputation. For the money we paid for this hotel, staying in the superior room, we were not so pleased. I think it's overrated. The room that we had, had a sink with a very slow drain and we called to have it fixed and nothing was done. There was one employee, though, that was super nice. He moved us and our luggage and belongings when he found out that someone missed our request for a nonsmoking room at the time of reservation. The rooms aren't really sound proofed and being next to La Rambla, it was hard to have a good sleep. The food wasn't great either. We had the New Year's eve party at the Eurostar Grand Marina Hotel and stayed there one night and it was less money and more amenities like 2 toilets, and bigger room and the food for that party was awesome!
reviews.title: Overrated Hotel

likes.disliked: — overrated, expensive, doesn't live up to expectations, the little gym

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I spent 4 days at this great hotel. The rooms were vary spacious (USA Standards) then most European hotels. Flat screens, great baths, and linen.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

likes.liked: — Size and type of room accomodations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The staff was extremely helpful and friendly.
reviews.title: Love the Hotel 1898

likes.disliked: — Not receiving replies to my emails to hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed here with my partner for two nights in November.
reviews.title: Book it, this hotel is great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Had an outstanding experience. Great value for money, booked room through lastminute.com for £100.
reviews.title: We just loved it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Spa facilities were the highlight for me.
reviews.title: Fabulous times at 1898

likes.disliked: — ask for room off La Ramblas to ensure quiet room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room was superb and I would still stay here if the price were double.
reviews.title: a lovely hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast worth doing once although is a little expensive at $18 but the selection is vast. There are plenty of places nearby to take breakfast and the fruit market is on the your doorstep.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just returned from 3 nights in the 1898 celebrating my 40th Birthday. Being No1 on trip advisor was the reason we booked this hotel. We read the very few negatives on here and this is what i think. You will always get people who are never satisfied with anything, you know the type. they are at the reception desks screaming at the staff about the slightest issue, no wonder then they get nothing sorted because lets face it, no place or event in the world is perfect and i suppose the true test of a hotel is how they react when things go slightly wrong because hey this is the reality of every day life. So firstly we got to our room, great room but right outside the elevator, based on previous comments i didnt want to settle in the room and find i could hear the elevators through the night (im a light sleeper) so we went down to reception straight away and explained.(by the way they have removed the lift bell on those floors now anyway) we got a better room issued immediately ! Result ! But you know what, if you speak politely without attitude and explain the issue, 99 times out 100, you get it sorted, and thats the point about the negatives reviews here. Next we ordered some bollinger off the menu at 80 euro's, good price i thought, when we got the bill it had 130 euro's on it, on checking the menu i had been given an old menu, no problem sir the correct price is actually 130 euro which i have to charge you but what i will give you is free drinks for the rest of the night !!!(we drunk easily more than twice the diff)- result No 2. Next morning we ordered 2 types of breakfast, they only brought one, on ringing the kitchen they apologised and the other was with us within 3 mins - result no 3. The reception were very helpful with ordering taxis( you cant be charged double going to the airport because they are all on meters NB previous review) and booking restaurants, in fact they got us into a restaurant that was full because they regularly send customers there. We didnt really do any site seeing, it was relax in the sun, wine and dine break and the hotel is perfect for that. The Ramblas outside the hotel is madness in august, it is so busy, so when you step back into the hotel it is like an Oasis of calm and tranquility, and for the previous comment about the bar been quite - what do you want when you have been in crowds of people all day ! certainly not queueing with hoards of noisy people at the bar. If your looking for the better bars and restaurants then turn left has you come out the hotel onto the Ramblas and walk couple of 100 yards up, this way you get away from all the tourists coming off the boats and getting trapped in the Ramblas restaurants which are poor food/high prices. 2 places were excellent, a traditional tapas bar called Alfonso for lunch and theTralaguz restaurant for a big night meal.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel - Tranquility in the madness of Ramblas

likes.liked: — quality bed and furnishings, electronic gadgets, silent aircon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Everyone has said it all already!!!
reviews.title: Great Location...beautiful Hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stay here...the only painful part is the price of the cocktails...but after your 3rd amazing Mojito..you will not care!!!!
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel

likes.liked: — It was so quiet in the middle of a noisy area!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We book thru their website and found a package that included break for only 10 euros more a night...totally worth it!
reviews.title: Fantastic
What a find!
reviews.text: GO NOW...and have fun!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006
reviews.text: We were in Barcelona for three nights. Since we had booked the opera, the 1898 (being such a short walking distance from the Liceu) was an obvious choice. We found it to be a highly elegant, modern and friendly hotel. And was excellent value when compared with the high prices often charged here in the UK
reviews.title: Highly recommended for an elegant stay (Member in Surrey, UK)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: But there are a couple of points prospective visitors might like to keep in mind.
reviews.title: Honeymoon 10/23/2006

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Firstly the breakfast is not cheap. But if you intend to have a really good meal to see you through much of the day, then I certainly recommend it. But if, like me, you prefer a very light snack you could do better to go along the road towards the Liceu and enjoy a coffee and an excellent pastry for a fraction of the cost.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel in the heart of the city.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Also the bar is expensive and not good. We paid a high price for our dry martini (which we didn't object to given the status of the hotel) but it was not a particularly good one (being too ice-melt diluted) and came without any customary cocktail 'nibbles' that enhance the occasion and one could expect at this price. So having a drink was a rather 'triste' experience , which we certainly did not repeat.
reviews.title: Great Hotel in Superb Location

likes.liked: — Fantastic room, huge bed and excellent bathroom

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We started our honeymoon in Barcelona at Hotel 1898. It was a hip hotel in a great location. I did find it humorous that the only Starbucks in Barcelona was attached to our hotel...yes, a guilty pleasure of mine in the US, but the last thing I wanted to see in Spain! Our room was lovely with a great terrace. Our bartender was very sweet (Lucas). The library was nice with two computers and free email. Classy hotel!
reviews.title: Great hotel

likes.liked: — The roof terrace and the interior

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We went to Barca a couple of years back and had our stay spoilt by an overrated shabby hotel. Needless to say, our experience prompted us to be a bit more thorough in our hotel research since then and it was time to return to what has now become our favourite short break destination.
reviews.title: "I'll be back!!!"

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our research led us to this gem of a hotel situated as near as can be to the centre of Barcelona and unlike our previous hotel encounter in this magnificent city, this hotel did live up to the hype.
reviews.title: My best hotel experience ever!

likes.disliked: — We had to leave after two nights!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: From the friendly helpful concierge who greeted us at the door we knew we were in for a good stay. The staff were always falling over backwards to help, and when I wasn't too sure of my skills with the Spanish language, most of the staff spoke good English and were always polite and welcoming.
reviews.title: Exquisite Hotel, Fantastic Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was very well appointent with a large double bed, lcd tv on the wall, good sized bathroom with power shower and small balcony. Although as expected in the middle of the city, the views were of other buildings, this was a welcome touch. The rooms were very clean and toiletries and mini bar were well stocked.
reviews.title: Loved it, Loved it, Loved it

likes.disliked: — Staff could be better (but that is being really picky)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Unfortunately it was a bit cold in December to test out the rooftop pool so I am unable to comment on that but would expect that if it is in keeping with the rest of the hotel, then it would be just as good.
reviews.title: A Fine Hotel - Value for Money

likes.disliked: — Breakfast can get cold if you're slow off the mark

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: We only stayed in the hotel one night before we joined a cruise ship for our honeymoon. But the hotel was great, the room was lovely - very stylish, the bathroom was fantastic and we even had a little terrace area with a table and chairs even though we had booked one of the cheapest rooms. We ate dinner that night on that terrace using room service (we were so tired!) which was brought to us in very efficient time. The menu is a little basic but tasted great! We then walked around the city the following morning to get a taste. The location of the hotel is great and gives you a real feel for the city. We would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Blessed oasis of calm and order

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we booked this hotel after reading the reviews on here and a recommendation from a friend, and can honestly say we weren't disappointed. the location is spot on, just off la rambla, and the room was fantastic. we were thoroughly impressed by the size and cleanliness of the room, and it was very nicely done out. the room service was spot on, and we found the staff to be very helpful. we were told by our friend to ask for directions to the tapas bar they recommend, and we loved it there so much we went back the next night!! we loved the rooftop bar, which was especially nice after a hard day's shopping and sightseeing! yeah the drinks aren't cheap, but then again they aren't cheap in london either and i think thats the kinda price you'll pay in a big city. they do a mean margarita which is well worth the money though!!! theres a metro stop nearby and its only a short walk to the harbour where you can do boat trips and theres a lovely shopping mall too. if you're looking for a good hotel with a central location, decent breakfasts, nice rooms and helpful staff then you found it here!
reviews.title: cracking hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great hotel, ideal location for staying in barcelona. Roof terrace is great, large bed sized loungers, has to be seen to be believed!! Terrace bar and pool. Great views of city from terrace. Hotel spa and indoor pool also greta. Rooms very modern and well presented. Clean and spacious.
reviews.title: fab hotel, ideal location

likes.disliked: — room a little dark, but not a problem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Right on las ramblas, so in the heart of barcelona. Enjoyed stay, but hotel was a real asset to the holiday.
reviews.title: A nice place to stay in Barcelona

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Unique experience. We stayed here for two nights, August 1&2. I've seen many hotels over the years, both for business and leisure, ranging from Eur20/night to Eur500/night. H1898 beats them all. Easily. Very distincitive in every respect, from the beautiful lobby to the indoor pool and great rooms (nicely decorated, high ceilings, huge bed, excellent pillow service). Best of all is the rooftop terrace with great 360 view of Barca...and a pool.
reviews.title: Amazing hotel, loved it.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is right at the heart of La Rambla, so it is walking distance to the best sites to see in Barcelona. Rates are among the highest, but it is truly a well worth indulgence - with their high thread count sheets, excellent spa facilities, cozy lounges and quiet rooms (considering it's right in front of a bustling street). A historic hotel with ultra-modern amenities, Hotel 1898 is a landmark of luxury and comfort in Barcelona.
reviews.title: Great hotel at a great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: We just returned home after a 4 day stay at the 1898 Hotel in Barcelona. We had two rooms, each with a somewhat different decor, but both were quiet and extremely comfortable. We were impressed by the helpfulness of the staff, the unique features of the rooms (e.g., multiple different lighting settings), the convenience of the computers in the business center, and the wonderful location (right on La Rambla and within walking distance of many sights, restaurants and shopping venues). The rooftop pool was perfect for those wanting to sun themselves and the indoor pool was equally relaxing (and uniquely designed). We have traveled many times, in many countries but this hotel will remain one of our favorites!
reviews.title: Outstanding Hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is fabulous , we arrived in Barcelona to learn that the city was celebrating it's largest festival. The city was mainc and the hotel was just a haven of peace and tranquility.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It's location was superb, right in the heart of the city and just of Las Rambals. The hotel decor is stylish and beautiful. We arrived early and were lucky that our room was ready. The room itself was there standard room. It wasn't large but beautifully decorated and well equipt for everything you would need. The bathroom was well stocked with toiletries, and included bathrobes and slippers. The hotel offer a special pillow service so that you can change your pillow if you have a particular preference. I particularly liked the light controls located next to the bed, at the touch of a button you can change the lighting to relax mode, reading mode etc.
reviews.title: Very nice Hotel
Love it!
reviews.text: The facilities were excellent , the roof pool and terrace was spectacular, and lovely just to sit and have a drink . The basement pool was equally impressive and very relaxing. I even used the gym which was adequate for a quick workout.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast is served on the first floor and there was a wide choice of food available from cakes to cerals,and juice to cooked sausages, bacon and scrambled eggs. All the staff were polite and very helpful, I would not hesitate to come back again it really deserves a five star rating, and I have already started to recommend it to all my friends.
reviews.title: Great hotel, great location

likes.disliked: — Small room, poor view - ask for an upgrade

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was their mid-range deluxe. With hardwood floors, granite bathroom, and terrace overlooking small plaza to the side of the hotel. The bed was oversized King (California King) and was luxurious. We adjusted the room temp several times with the thermostat and were pleased with the ability to control the room temp.
reviews.title: great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just returned from a 3-night break in early May. The H1898 is a well-presented modern boutique-style hotel in an absolutely fabulous central location on Las Ramblas. Despite the busy location the hotel was an oasis of calm and our room (which faced into a central courtyard/atrium) was quiet whatever the hour.
reviews.title: Perfect for a short break
FANTASTIC!!!!
reviews.text: This was a magnificent hotel. The entire staff was extremely cordial. From the bellhop to the check-in to housekeeping. The hotel is absolutely beautiful. It's almost like a hidden gem. It's right off La Rambla. The rooftop bar is spectacular. THEY HAVE BEDS!!!! My friend and I hung out and had some beverages and just chilled out and enjoyed the view of Barcelona at night.

reviews.title: An excellent centrally located hotel
reviews.text: We had a room with a balcony that looked over into 3 restaurants with outdoor seating. We kept the door open just to hear the hustle and bustle at night. Once it was bedtime, we closed the doors and we didn't hear anything. The rooms are absolutely gorgeous. There was only 1 thing I didn't like about the room. The bathtub was too damn high LOL. I thought I was going to fall everytime I got in and out of the shower. Oh and there were about 52 knobs to turn on the shower. Like I said, these were minor details. When I return to Barcelona, I'm DEFINITELY staying at H1898. Oh by the way, you get the cutest little slippers.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I will add photos later.
reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel in Barcelona

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: My wife and I reviewed quite a few hotels on line before choosing Hotel 1898 and I am so happy that we picked it. The hotel can be summed up simply - A centrally located, clean, very chilled/modern hotel with excellent/attentive staff and very good facilities.
reviews.title: Perfect Barcelona Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have stayed in quite a few hotels in Europe and we both agreed that it is one of the best.
reviews.title: Stylish and comfortable

description: Hotel in Las Ramblas, in the center of Barcelona. Hotel 1898 is the only offering spa and 2 swimming pools all year open. A hotel where luxury and small pleasures will take you to the 19th century and the Spanish colonies in Cuba and the Philippines. Discover our Colonial Suites with private terrace and swimming pool. An authentic oasis in the heart of Barcelona.
